factoid: Nicholas dismounted.
Nicholas, Natásha, and Pétya stopped near the hounds.
Nicholas, Natásha, and Pétya were waiting to see how the matter would end.
A huntsman emerged from the bushes.
The huntsman had been fighting.
The huntsman rode toward his young master.
The huntsman had a fox tied to his crupper.
The huntsman, while still at a distance, took off his cap.
The huntsman tried to speak respectfully.
The huntsman was pale.
The huntsman was breathless.
The huntsman's face was angry.
The huntsman had one eye that was black.
The huntsman probably was not even aware of the black eye.
Nicholas asked what had happened.
The huntsman said that killing a fox our dogs had hunted was a likely thing.
The huntsman said that his gray bitch caught the fox.
The huntsman said go to law.
The huntsman said he snatches at the fox.
The huntsman said he gave him one with the fox.
The huntsman said here it is on his saddle.
The huntsman asked if you want a taste of this.
The huntsman pointed to his dagger.
The huntsman probably imagined himself still speaking to his foe.
Nicholas did not stop to talk to the huntsman.
Nicholas asked Natásha and Pétya to wait for him.
Nicholas rode to the spot where Ilágin's hunting party was.
The huntsman rode off to join the field.
The huntsman was surrounded by inquiring sympathizers.
The huntsman recounted his exploits.
Ilágin had a quarrel with the Rostóvs.
Ilágin and the Rostóvs were at law.
Ilágin hunted over places that belonged by custom to the Rostóvs.
Ilágin sent his men to the woods the Rostóvs were hunting.
Ilágin sent his men to the woods purposely.
Ilágin let his man snatch a fox the Rostóvs had chased.
Nicholas had never seen Ilágin.
Nicholas had a usual absence of moderation in judgment.
Nicholas hated Ilágin cordially because of reports of Ilágin's arbitrariness and violence.
Nicholas regarded Ilágin as his bitterest foe.
Nicholas rode toward Ilágin in angry agitation.
Nicholas firmly grasped his whip.
Nicholas was fully prepared to take resolute and desperate steps to punish Ilágin.
A stout gentleman in a beaver cap rode toward Nicholas on a raven-black horse.
The gentleman was accompanied by two hunt servants.
Nicholas found Ilágin to be a stately and courteous gentleman.
Ilágin was anxious to make Nicholas's acquaintance.
Ilágin rode up to Nicholas.
Ilágin raised his beaver cap.
Ilágin said he much regretted what had occurred.
Ilágin said he would have the man punished who had allowed himself to seize a fox hunted by someone else's borzois.
Ilágin hoped to become better acquainted with Nicholas.
Ilágin invited Nicholas to draw his covert.
Natásha was afraid that Nicholas would do something dreadful.
Natásha followed Ilágin in excitement.
Natásha saw the enemies exchanging friendly greetings.
Natásha rode up to the enemies.
Ilágin lifted his beaver cap higher to Natásha.
Ilágin said with a pleasant smile that the young countess resembled Diana in her passion for the chase.
Ilágin said with a pleasant smile that the young countess resembled Diana in her beauty.
Ilágin had heard much about the young countess's beauty.
Ilágin pressed the Rostóvs to come to an upland about a mile away.
The upland was usually kept for Ilágin himself.
The upland swarmed with hares.
Nicholas agreed.
The hunt was now doubled.
The hunt moved on.
The way to Ilágin's upland was across the fields.
The hunt servants fell into line.
The masters rode together.
Rostóv and Ilágin kept stealthily glancing at each other's dogs.
Rostóv and Ilágin tried not to be observed by their companions.
Rostóv and Ilágin searched uneasily for rivals to their own borzois.
Rostóv was struck by the beauty of a small pure-bred red-spotted bitch on Ilágin's leash.
The bitch was slender.
The bitch had muscles like steel.
The bitch had a delicate muzzle.
The bitch had prominent black eyes.
Rostóv had heard of the swiftness of Ilágin's borzois.
Rostóv saw the bitch as a rival to his own Mílka.
Ilágin began a sober conversation about the year's harvest.
Nicholas pointed to the red-spotted bitch.
Nicholas said "A fine little bitch, that!".
Nicholas asked "Is she swift?".
